Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the success of Bill White's program by stating that "almost every city in our state has replicated" it.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific evidence or data to support the assertion that "almost every city in our state has replicated" the program.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the success of the program is solely attributed to Bill White's efforts, without considering other factors or initiatives that may have contributed to the replication.
Understate: The claim may be understating the number of cities that have actually replicated the program, as it states that only 20 cities out of approximately 1,200 incorporated cities in the state have done so.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the replication of the program, such as the influence of other organizations or initiatives in promoting similar efforts to reduce dropout rates.
